# layoutManager

**Instance Property**

The text container’s layout manager.

## Declaration

```swift
unowned(unsafe) var layoutManager: NSLayoutManager? { get set }
```

## Discussion

Avoid assigning a layout manager directly through this property. Instead, use the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/NSTextContainer/replaceLayoutManager(_:)] method when you want to replace the layout manager. The framework sets the value of this property automatically when you add a text container to your layout manager using the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/NSLayoutManager/addTextContainer(_:)] method.

## Related Documentation

- **addTextContainer(_:)**: Appends the specified text container to the series of text containers where the layout manager arranges text.

## Managing text components

- **textLayoutManager**
- **replaceLayoutManager(_:)**: Replaces the layout manager for the group of text system objects that contains the text container.
- **textView**: The text container’s text view.
